Mrs. Duncan, an amazing Kinder teacher at OSES, posted the following this morning:

Some students seem to struggle with motivation when doing their school work. Even seasoned teachers have trouble with motivating students from time to time. It is a big conversation in my head when I have students who are not progressing as I know what they are capable of. I wonder why they are having such a struggle. Are they bored? Are they being defiant? Is the lesson too difficult? Are they unsure of the directions? Ask yourself these same questions, and ask their teacher for suggestions of what to do. Include your student in the conversation as well, and you might consider asking him/her what they suggest. I am often surprised at what they say.

Such a good reminder for each of us parents who are struggling to support our kids in this unusual time!

#riseABOVEtheTIDE

Wed. 1/15/2020--Weather Update

Families,

Several have inquired about "sending kids home early." Once we have our scholars at school we typically would NOT send them home early. North Beach Parents: Beginning today, through October 4th, we're shuffling bus routes slightly due to a shortage of drivers. The impact may mean a 10-15 minute delay on some routes. Our shortage is due to the daily needs, athletic trips, and several unavoidable absences by our amazing driver team.

During the 19-20 school year the district purchased new radios that allow all buildings to radio directly to all buses. If you ever have questions, simply call your scholar's school or the district office and we can trouble shoot together.

Our Director of Transportation, Amy Butler, is doing an amazing job working with the team and adjusting. Feel free to email her if you have specific questions at abutler@northbeachschools.org

Thank you in advance for your understanding! If you've ever dreamed of driving school bus, even as a substitute....we're hiring!
